answers.answer: Hi there. Reduced amplitude in left peroneal motor nerve indicates axonal disease. You have left tibial motor nerve neuropathy. Certain causes are compression of  nerve roots in the lumbar spine, B12 and folate deficiencies, hypothyroidism, diabetes usually causes distal sensory neuropathy, toxins, alcoholism, autoimmune disorders like rheumatoid arthritis, Multiple sclerosis etc. consult your neurologist for correlating the NCV  findings with clinical findings and the possible causes. Take care.
